subject: AI
title: The Agent Loop
description: Perceive, decide, act, observe â€” the core cycle.

hook.text: You ask an agent to 'find the cheapest flight to Tokyo next week.' It doesn't answer in one shot â€” it runs a loop of searches, comparisons, and decisions.

buildup.text: Step 1: Parse the goal. Step 2: Decide which tool to call (search flights). Step 3: Read the results. Step 4: Decide the next action (filter by price). Step 5: Repeat until done.

discovery.text: Each iteration of the loop is one 'thought-action-observation' cycle. The LLM reasons about what to do, calls a tool, reads the output, and decides the next step.

twist.text: The loop can run forever if the agent never decides it's done. Every agent needs a termination condition: max iterations, goal achieved, or explicit 'give up' logic.

climax.text: The agent loop is simple in concept but tricky in practice. Getting the model to loop correctly â€” knowing when to act, when to think, and when to stop â€” is the hard part.

punchline.text: Think. Act. Observe. Repeat. Simple loop, powerful results â€” when it terminates.

quiz.question: Why does every agent loop need a termination condition?
options: To prevent infinite loops when the agent can't achieve its goal
